Assault Rifles.name: AR-23 Liberator
Assault Rifles.description: The SEAF standard assault rifle, balancing power, fire rate, and weight for a reliable weapon against smaller targets.

Assault Rifles.name: AR-23P Liberator Penetrator
Assault Rifles.description: A modified Liberator fitted with a scope and firing armor-piercing rounds, to help users take down armored targets.

Assault Rifles.name: AR-23C Liberator Concussive
Assault Rifles.description: A modified Liberator firing concussive rounds which do less damage but stagger enemies.

Assault Rifles.name: AR-23A Liberator Carbine
Assault Rifles.description: A compact version of the Liberator designed to increase viability in close quarters. Has an increased fire rate at the cost of higher spread.

Assault Rifles.name: AR-61 Tenderizer
Assault Rifles.description: A high-caliber assault rifle with a restrictive magazine size but more stopping power.

Assault Rifles.name: BR-14 Adjudicator
Assault Rifles.description: An accurate, armor-penetrating rifle, the BR-14 Adjudicator delivers righteous judgement to medium-sized enemies, though its restrictive magazine limits its effectiveness against large groups.

Marksman Rifles.name: R-63 Diligence
Marksman Rifles.description: This high-caliber marksman rifle trades magazine capacity and rate of fire for powerful, accurate shots.

Marksman Rifles.name: R-63CS Diligence Counter Sniper
Marksman Rifles.description: A modified Diligence rifle offering increased damage, but a reduced rate of fire. Fires a single bullet at a time.

Submachine Guns.name: MP-98 Knight
Submachine Guns.description: A submachine gun with an extremely high rate of fire, which can be operated with one hand. Ideal for multitasking.

Submachine Guns.name: SMG-37 Defender
Submachine Guns.description: A high-caliber submachine gun which can be fired with one hand. Has a relatively low rate of fire.

Submachine Guns.name: SMG-72 Pummeler
Submachine Guns.description: Fires concussive rounds that stagger enemies. Slower rate of fire than other SMGs.

Shotguns.name: SG-8 Punisher
Shotguns.description: A powerful dual magazine pump-action shotgun, with limited armor penetration. Ideal for small and fast targets.

Shotguns.name: SG-8S Slugger
Shotguns.description: A modified Punisher shotgun firing heavy, high-damage slug rounds. Perfect for punching big holes in big targets.

Shotguns.name: SG-451 Cookout
Shotguns.description: A pump shotgun that fires a burst of incendiary phosphorus pellets, setting targets ablaze.

Shotguns.name: SG-225 Breaker
Shotguns.description: A fully-automatic shotgun with a high rate of fire, excellent for controlling crowds. Requires frequent reloading.

Shotguns.name: SG-225SP Breaker Spray&Pray
Shotguns.description: A modified Breaker Shotgun firing birdshot, small pellets which saturate an area to clear up smaller targets.

Shotguns.name: SG-225IE Breaker Incendiary
Shotguns.description: A modified Breaker Shotgun firing incendiary projectiles. Generates heat during use, so limited to burst fire.

Explosive.name: CB-9 Exploding Crossbow
Explosive.description: Fires powerful exploding bolts which do maximum damage upon direct impact. Gravity must be accounted for when aiming.

Explosive.name: JAR-5 Dominator
Explosive.description: Firing jet-propelled rounds, the Dominator trades fire rate and magazine capacity for increased damage per projectile.

Explosive.name: R-35 Eruptor
Explosive.description: This bolt-action rifle fires jet-assisted shells that explode shrapnel in all directions upon impact. Not recommended for close-quarters use.

Energy-Based.name: SG-8P Punisher Plasma
Energy-Based.description: A modified Punisher shotgun firing exploding plasma rounds. Fire carefully - exploding plasma can injure squadmates.

Energy-Based.name: ARC-12 Blitzer
Energy-Based.description: This shotgun blasts a wide burst of high-voltage electricity that arcs between all units—enemy or otherwise—within range.

Energy-Based.name: LAS-5 Scythe
Energy-Based.description: A laser rifle firing a continuous beam. Does not need reloading, but if it overheats a new heat sink must be fitted.

Energy-Based.name: LAS-16 Sickle
Energy-Based.description: A laser rifle, firing in short bursts. Does not need reloading, but if it overheats a new heat sink must be fitted.

Energy-Based.name: PLAS-1 Scorcher
Energy-Based.description: A plasma rifle, firing a bolt of superheated gas which explodes on impact. Avoid standing in proximity to the blast.

Energy-Based.name: PLAS-101 Purifier
Energy-Based.description: A plasma rifle firing a bolt of superheated gase which explodes on impact. Each shot must be charged up fully before it can be fired.

Special.name: FLAM-66 Torcher
Special.description: A lightweight flamethrower. Shoots pressurized fuel through a dispersion nozzle into an open flame. Safe.

Pistols.name: P-2 Peacemaker
Pistols.description: The SEAF standard pistol - offering a high fire rate, generous capacity, and fast reloading.

Pistols.name: P-19 Redeemer
Pistols.description: A fully-automatic pistol with an extremely high fire rate, allowing for efficient crowd control.

Pistols.name: P-113 Verdict
Pistols.description: The gas-operated, semiautomatic P-113 chambers the 14mm "Rapid Deliberation," the largest centerfire cartridge of any magazine-fed pistol.

Pistols.name: P-4 Senator
Pistols.description: A high-damage revolver, which can be reloaded with single rounds. A heavy-hitting and reliable sidearm.

Special.name: SG-22 Bushwhacker
Special.description: A triple-barreled, break-action, sawed-off shotgun. Switch firing modes to fire all three barrels at once.

Special.name: P-72 Crisper
Special.description: A compact handgun-style flamethrower, able to project a jet of fire over short distances.

Special.name: GP-31 Grenade Pistol
Special.description: A pistol that fires grenades. Must be reloaded between shots.

Special.name: LAS-7 Dagger
Special.description: A laser pistol that fires a continuous beam. Does not require ammo but can overheat and need to change batteries.

Standard Throwables.name: G-6 Frag
Standard Throwables.description: An antipersonnel fragmentation grenade. Creates damage over a large area when detonated.

Standard Throwables.name: G-12 High Explosive
Standard Throwables.description: A high explosive grenade which damages lightly armored targets. Creates high damage over a small area when detonated.

Standard Throwables.name: G-10 Incendiary
Standard Throwables.description: An incendiary grenade which ignites any targets and terrain within the blast radius. Use with caution.

Special Throwables.name: G-16 Impact
Special Throwables.description: A high explosive grenade which detonates on first impact.

Special Throwables.name: G-13 Incendiary Impact
Special Throwables.description: Detonates on impact, covering the immediate vicinity in self-igniting white phosphorus.

Special Throwables.name: G-23 Stun
Special Throwables.description: Temporarily stuns all targets within the effective radius.

Special Throwables.name: G-4 Gas
Special Throwables.description: A grenade that releases a cloud of caustic gas, effective against both organic and inorganic enemies.

Special Throwables.name: G-3 Smoke
Special Throwables.description: A 'compliance weapon' to modify enemy behaviour. Creates a thick smoke screen to block targets' line of sight.

Special Throwables.name: G-123 Thermite
Special Throwables.description: A thermite grenade designed to adhere to surfaces before burning at 2000°C. Capable of burning through some armor.

Special Throwables.name: K-2 Throwing Knife
Special Throwables.description: Delivers silent justice to Freedom's enemies.

light.name: FS-37 Ravager
light.description: Contains many small pockets, allowing the user to evenly distribute weight of ammunition sample, and cool rocks.

armor passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

light.name: CW-4 Arctic Ranger
light.description: Features a utility belt with pockets that can be filled with any number of things, such as pocket knives, mementos from home, and interesting rocks.

armor passive.name: Scout
armor passive.description: Markers placed on the map will generate radar scans every 2.0s. Reduces range at which enemies can detect the wearer by 30%.

light.name: CE-74 Breaker
light.description: A domestic version of this armor is available for citizens who wish to perform efficient home renovation projects.

armor passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

light.name: CE-67 Titan
light.description: A quality product, this armor can destroy over 300,000 kilometers of fencing with no decline in operational efficiency.

armor passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

light.name: CM-21 Trench Paramedic
light.description: The suit was once designed to hold a variety of battlefield medical equipment. Now it holds a generous supply of stims.

armor passive.name: Med-Kit
armor passive.description: Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of stims by +2. Increases stim effect duration by 2.0s.

light.name: CE-07 Demolition Specialist
light.description: Originally worn by lunar terraformers, this suit can withstand rapid changes in preasure, heat, and personal velocity.

armor passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

light.name: FS-38 Eradicator
light.description: First deployed in the minds of Cyberstan, where it offered protection against explosions in the hydrogen-rich caverns.

armor passive.name: Fortified
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Provides 50% resistance to explosive damage.

light.name: EX-00 Prototype X
light.description: The end result of several billion Super Credits and 12 years of research into creating "the Soldier of Tomorrow."

armor passive.name: Electrical Conduit
armor passive.description: Provides 95% resistance to arc damage.

light.name: SC-37 Legionnaire
light.description: This armor is based on the antique uniforms of the ‘Super Earth Legion’, a less patriotic precursor to the Helldivers.

armor passive.name: Servo-Assisted
armor passive.description: Increased throwing range by 30%. Provides +50% limb health.

light.name: B-08 Light Gunner
light.description: Compact and flexible, this kevlar armor adds minimal mass, making it a common choice for Helldiver fitness tests.

armor passive.name: Extra Padding
armor passive.description: Provides a higher armor rating.

light.name: SC-30 TrailBlazer Scout
light.description: The patented fabric absorbs visible, infrared, and ultraviolet radiation, to prevent detection by all known species.

armor passive.name: Scout
armor passive.description: Markers placed on the map will generate radar scans every 2.0s. Reduces range at which enemies can detect the wearer by 30%.

light.name: SC-34 Infiltrator
light.description: This suit's plutonium-238 nuclear battery enables environmental scanning long after the user has ceased operation.

armor passive.name: Scout
armor passive.description: Markers placed on the map will generate radar scans every 2.0s. Reduces range at which enemies can detect the wearer by 30%.

light.name: AF-50 Noxious Ranger
light.description: "We fear not poison, fear not death; spite our foes with every breath." From the beloved classic Hazard Pay: The Musical.

armor passive.name: Advanced Filtration
armor passive.description: Provides 80% resistance to gas damage and effects.

light.name: PH-9 Predator
light.description: Based on the uniform of Jackle 6, a veteran of the Viper Commandos who held off an entire Terminid brood on Nublaria in the First Galactic War with nothing but a machine gun, pocket knife, and Orbital Laser Strikes.

armor passive.name: Peak Physique
armor passive.description: Increases melee damage by 50%. Improves weapons handling with less drag on weapon movement.

light.name: I-09 Heatseeker
light.description: The burnished blood-red plates are forged in righteous fire, like the heroes they were wrought to protect.

armor passive.name: Inflammable
armor passive.description: Provides 75% damage resistance to fire allowing bearer to rest assured in their inflammability

medium.name: SA-25 Steel Trooper
medium.description: For optimal performance, the manufacturer recommends avoiding immersing this armor in salt water for prolonged periods.

armor passive.name: Servo-Assisted
armor passive.description: Increased throwing range by 30%. Provides +50% limb health.

medium.name: SA-12 Servo Assisted
medium.description: Each servo-assisted limb contains 138 miniature motors, to support a natural gait and long-term spinal health.

armor passive.name: Servo-Assisted
armor passive.description: Increased throwing range by 30%. Provides +50% limb health.

medium.name: CE-35 Trench Engineer
medium.description: After colonists of Hellmire recovered a lost shipment of this armor, the local pastime of fence-smashing was born.

armor passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

medium.name: CE-27 Ground Breaker
medium.description: "The ground is just another obstable that hasn't yet been cleared." - SGM Janet Jones, Excavation Corps Founder

armor passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

medium.name: CM-09 Bonesnapper
medium.description: Based on a colonial surgeon's gown, where surgeries were often interrupted by a need to perform defensive duties.

armor passive.name: Med-Kit
armor passive.description: Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of stims by +2. Increases stim effect duration by 2.0s.

medium.name: CM-10 Clinician
medium.description: Featuring patented reverse-seam technology, to reduce the likelihood of bodily fluids entering the armor's interior.

armor passive.name: Med-Kit
armor passive.description: Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of stims by +2. Increases stim effect duration by 2.0s.

medium.name: SC-15 Drone Master
medium.description: Some soldiers report picking up strange radio interference when wearing this armor near alien artifacts.

armor passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

medium.name: EX-03 Prototype 3
medium.description: Because this prototype's wire operates at 400,000 volts, it also includes a handy rubber underlayer for insulation.

armor passive.name: Electrical Conduit
armor passive.description: Provides 95% resistance to arc damage.

medium.name: EX-16 Prototype 16
medium.description: As the electric arc generates a strong magnetic field, wearers should avoid use while in vinicity of stapled paperwork.

armor passive.name: Electrical Conduit
armor passive.description: Provides 95% resistance to arc damage.

medium.name: FS-34 Exterminator
medium.description: Features a patented non-stick coating, which makes scraping viscera off after a long day of battle less taxing.

armor passive.name: Fortified
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Provides 50% resistance to explosive damage.

medium.name: DP-40 Hero of the Federation
medium.description: Though originally indended solely for ceremonial use, its inspirational energy proved equally useful on the battlefield.

armor passive.name: Democracy Protects
armor passive.description: 50% chance to not die when taking lethal damage. Prevents all damage from bleeding if chest hemorrhages.

medium.name: DP-11 Champion of the People
medium.description: The three stripes on the pauldrons stand for the three principles of Super Earth: Liberty, Democracy, and Prosperity.

armor passive.name: Democracy Protects
armor passive.description: 50% chance to not die when taking lethal damage. Prevents all damage from bleeding if chest hemorrhages.

medium.name: CM-14 Physician
medium.description: The distinctive red, white, and green of the Intergalactic Medical Corps signals to all Helldivers that help is at hand.

armor passive.name: Med-Kit
armor passive.description: Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of stims by +2. Increases stim effect duration by 2.0s.

medium.name: TR-117 Alpha Commander
medium.description: For warriors who are so strong and confident that they don't need any reassurance whatsoever.

armor passive.name: Med-Kit
armor passive.description: Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of stims by +2. Increases stim effect duration by 2.0s.

medium.name: CE-81 Jugganaut
medium.description: One of the most durable engineer armors available, each set is quality tested by an impact with a full-grown Charger.

armor passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

medium.name: DP-53 Savior of the Free
medium.description: A faithful replica of the armor worn at The Battle of Liberty Peak. Honor their legacy, and wear it with pride.

armor passive.name: Democracy Protects
armor passive.description: 50% chance to not die when taking lethal damage. Prevents all damage from bleeding if chest hemorrhages.

medium.name: B-24 Enforcer
medium.description: In field tests, 84% of users said that the armor improved their posture and self-esteem.

armor passive.name: Fortified
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Provides 50% resistance to explosive damage.

medium.name: B-01 Tactical v1
medium.description: This armor is the Super Earch Standard Issue, made from the same titanium alloy as the Destroyer's hull.

medium.name: TR-40 Gold Eagle
medium.description: This high-visibility armor allows its bearer to be easily seen through smoke, fog, and spewing viscera.

medium.name: AF-91 Field Chemist
medium.description: This armor, together with its friendly-faced helmet, is instantly recognizable from the beloved children's show "Jen Shriver the Science Diver."

armor passive.description: Provides 80% resistance to gas damage and effects.

medium.name: CW-9 White Wolf
medium.description: Featuring patented reverse-seam technology, to reduce the likelihood of bodily fluids entering the armor's interior.

armor passive.name: Extra Padding
armor passive.description: Provides a higher armor rating.

medium.name: PH-56 Jaguar
medium.description: "Prowl like a jaguar, strike like a viper." –Motto of the storied SEAF special operations unit whose real exploits were portrayed in the classic comic book series "Tales of the Viper Commandos."

armor passive.name: Peak Physique
armor passive.description: Increases melee damage by 50%. Improves weapons handling with less drag on weapon movement.

medium.name: I-92 Fire Fighter
medium.description: The heavy rubber tunic and reflective limb guards, originally designed to save citizens from burning buildings, now enable the liberal application of the cleansing fires of Justice.

armor passive.name: Inflammable
armor passive.description: Provides 75% damage resistance to fire allowing bearer to rest assured in their inflammability

medium.name: SA-04 Combat Technician
medium.description: Due to the enhanced strength caused by this armor, caution is advised when using door handles or embracing colleagues.

armor passive.name: Scout
armor passive.description: Markers placed on the map will generate radar scans every 2.0s. Reduces range at which enemies can detect the wearer by 30%.

medium.name: AF-02 Haz-Master
medium.description: Developed by the Ministry of Science while investigating the phenomenon known as The Gloom, this armor is non-permeable and squeak resistant.

armor passive.name: Advanced Filtration
armor passive.description: Provides 80% resistance to gas damage and effects.

medium.name: I-102 Draconaught
medium.description: Completely sheathed in 14-cm silica fiber foam, except for a thin tube to the ear canal to enable hearing the satifying screeches of Freedom's enemies as they burn.

armor passive.name: Inflammable
armor passive.description: Provides 75% damage resistance to fire allowing bearer to rest assured in their inflammability

heavy.name: FS-55 Devastator
heavy.description: Contains many small pockets, allowing the user to evenly distribute the weight of ammunition, samples and cool rocks.

armor passive.name: Fortified
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Provides 50% resistance to explosive damage.

heavy.name: CW-22 Kodiak
heavy.description: The CW-22 Kodiak armor was thoroughly pressure-tested by patriotic volunteers, as part of the "Test Subjects for Super-Earth" Citizen Advancement Program.

armor passive.name: Fortified
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Provides 50% resistance to explosive damage.

heavy.name: SA-32 Dynamo
heavy.description: In mountainous colonies, domestic variants of this armore are used to throw weather monitoring equipment uphill.

armor passive.name: Servo-Assisted
armor passive.description: Increased throwing range by 30%. Provides +50% limb health.

heavy.name: CM-17 Butcher
heavy.description: An armor often worn by frontline surgeons, who are skilled at both putting bodies back together and taking them apart.

armor passive.description: Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of stims by +2. Increases stim effect duration by 2.0s.

heavy.name: FS-61 Dreadnought
heavy.description: With genuine gold accents, 74% of colonists voted this armor the set they would most like to be buried in.

armor passive.name: Servo-Assisted
armor passive.description: Increased throwing range by 30%. Provides +50% limb health.

heavy.name: B-27 Fortified Commando
heavy.description: This armor set first appeared in the music video for the summer anthem 'Out Love is Like Liberty (Indestructible)'.

armor passive.name: Extra Padding
armor passive.description: Provides a higher armor rating.

heavy.name: FS-05 Marksman
heavy.description: While early prototypes used shock-absorbing gels, this armor stabilizes aim with the use of internal gyroscopes.

armor passive.name: Fortified
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Provides 50% resistance to explosive damage.

heavy.name: FS-11 Executioner
heavy.description: Popularized by actor Chip Messiter, who wore this in the action-rom-com-musical "Lost My Heart to a Man in a Helmet".

armor passive.name: Fortified
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Provides 50% resistance to explosive damage.

heavy.name: AF-52 Lockdown
heavy.description: Heavily layered to protect against ocular blistering, subdermal liquification, and gastrointestinal shattering, this armor is a testament to the power of iterative improvements based on user feedback.

armor passive.name: Advanced Filtration
armor passive.description: Provides 80% resistance to gas damage and effects.

heavy.name: CE-64 Grenadier
heavy.description: The set's classic advertising campaign "Have you tried a grenade?" has remained unchanged for over 70 years.

armor passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

heavy.name: CE-101 Guerilla Gorilla
heavy.description: Heavily insulated from animal bites, enemy fire, and the histrionic diatribes of anarchists.

armor passive.name: Engineering Kit
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Increases initial inventory and holding capacity of throwables by +2.

heavy.name: I-44 Salamander
heavy.description: The signature orange pauldron allows easy battlefield detection of the bearer, alive or dead, on ash-strewn battlefields.

armor passive.name: Inflammable
armor passive.description: Provides 75% damage resistance to fire allowing bearer to rest assured in their inflammability

heavy.name: PH-202 Twigsnapper
heavy.description: The omission of upper-limb coverings allows for optimized freedom of movement, perspiration, and communication of upper body strength to squadmates.

armor passive.name: Peak Physique
armor passive.description: Increases melee damage by 50%. Improves weapons handling with less drag on weapon movement.

heavy.name: FS-23 Battle Master
heavy.description: This aim-stabalizing armor found suprising secondary market success among alien birdwatching enthusiasts.

armor passive.name: Fortified
armor passive.description: Further reduces recoil when crouching or prone by 30%. Provides 50% resistance to explosive damage.

heavy.name: CW-Winter Warrior
heavy.description: Offering camouflage in snowy environements, surplus sets of this armor are used by nature photographers and keen hunters alike.

armor passive.name: Servo-Assisted
armor passive.description: Increased throwing range by 30%. Provides +50% limb health.

helmets.description: This armor is based on the antique uniforms of the ‘Super Earth Legion’, a less patriotic precursor to the Helldivers.

helmets.name: B-08 Light Gunner
helmets.description: Compact and flexible, this kevlar armor adds minimal mass, making it a common choice for Helldiver fitness tests.

helmets.name: SC-30 TrailBlazer Scout
helmets.description: The patented fabric absorbs visible, infrared, and ultraviolet radiation, to prevent detection by all known species.

helmets.name: B-24 Enforcer
helmets.description: In field tests, 84% of users said that the armor improved their posture and self-esteem.

helmets.name: FS-05 Marksman
helmets.description: While early prototypes used shock-absorbing gels, this armor stabilizes aim with the use of internal gyroscopes.

helmets.name: FS-11 Executioner
helmets.description: Popularized by actor Chip Messiter, who wore this in the action-rom-com-musical "Lost My Heart to a Man in a Helmet".

helmets.name: SC-34 Infiltrator
helmets.description: This suit's plutonium-238 nuclear battery enables environmental scanning long after the user has ceased operation.

helmets.name: B-01 Tactical v1
helmets.description: This armor is the Super Earch Standard Issue, made from the same titanium alloy as the Destroyer's hull.

helmets.name: B-01 Tactical v2
helmets.description: This armor is the Super Earch Standard Issue, made from the same titanium alloy as the Destroyer's hull.

helmets.name: B-01 Tactical v3
helmets.description: This armor is the Super Earch Standard Issue, made from the same titanium alloy as the Destroyer's hull.

helmets.name: B-01 Tactical v4
helmets.description: This armor is the Super Earch Standard Issue, made from the same titanium alloy as the Destroyer's hull.

helmets.name: TR-40 Gold Eagle
helmets.description: This high-visibility armor allows its bearer to be easily seen through smoke, fog, and spewing viscera.

helmets.name: AF-52 Lockdown
helmets.description: Heavily layered to protect against ocular blistering, subdermal liquification, and gastrointestinal shattering, this armor is a testament to the power of iterative improvements based on user feedback.

helmets.name: AF-91 Field Chemist
helmets.description: This armor, together with its friendly-faced helmet, is instantly recognizable from the beloved children's show "Jen Shriver the Science Diver."

helmets.name: CW-9 White Wolf
helmets.description: Featuring patented reverse-seam technology, to reduce the likelihood of bodily fluids entering the armor's interior.

helmets.name: CE-64 Grenadier
helmets.description: The set's classic advertising campaign "Have you tried a grenade?" has remained unchanged for over 70 years.

helmets.name: PH-56 Jaguar
helmets.description: "Prowl like a jaguar, strike like a viper." –Motto of the storied SEAF special operations unit whose real exploits were portrayed in the classic comic book series "Tales of the Viper Commandos."

helmets.name: CE-101 Guerilla Gorilla
helmets.description: Heavily insulated from animal bites, enemy fire, and the histrionic diatribes of anarchists.

helmets.name: I-44 Salamander
helmets.description: The signature orange pauldron allows easy battlefield detection of the bearer, alive or dead, on ash-strewn battlefields.

helmets.name: I-92 Fire Fighter
helmets.description: The heavy rubber tunic and reflective limb guards, originally designed to save citizens from burning buildings, now enable the liberal application of the cleansing fires of Justice.

helmets.name: SA-04 Combat Technician
helmets.description: Due to the enhanced strength caused by this armor, caution is advised when using door handles or embracing colleagues.

helmets.name: AF-50 Noxious Ranger
helmets.description: "We fear not poison, fear not death; spite our foes with every breath." From the beloved classic Hazard Pay: The Musical.

helmets.name: AF-02 Haz-Master
helmets.description: Developed by the Ministry of Science while investigating the phenomenon known as The Gloom, this armor is non-permeable and squeak resistant.

helmets.name: PH-9 Predator
helmets.description: Based on the uniform of Jackle 6, a veteran of the Viper Commandos who held off an entire Terminid brood on Nublaria in the First Galactic War with nothing but a machine gun, pocket knife, and Orbital Laser Strikes.

helmets.name: PH-202 Twigsnapper
helmets.description: The omission of upper-limb coverings allows for optimized freedom of movement, perspiration, and communication of upper body strength to squadmates.

helmets.name: I-09 Heatseeker
helmets.description: The burnished blood-red plates are forged in righteous fire, like the heroes they were wrought to protect.

helmets.name: I-102 Draconaught
helmets.description: Completely sheathed in 14-cm silica fiber foam, except for a thin tube to the ear canal to enable hearing the satifying screeches of Freedom's enemies as they burn.

helmets.name: FS-23 Battle Master
helmets.description: This aim-stabalizing armor found suprising secondary market success among alien birdwatching enthusiasts.

helmets.name: CW-Winter Warrior
helmets.description: Offering camouflage in snowy environements, surplus sets of this armor are used by nature photographers and keen hunters alike.

helmets.name: DP-53 Savior of the Free
helmets.description: A faithful replica of the armor worn at The Battle of Liberty Peak. Honor their legacy, and wear it with pride.

helmets.name: TR-117 Alpha Commander
helmets.description: For warriors who are so strong and confident that they don't need any reassurance whatsoever.

capes.name: Tyrant Hunter
capes.description: The cape's shredded hem presages the unrelenting savagery its wielder will visit upon the nemeses of Freedom.

capes.name: Bastion of Integrity
capes.description: Based on a SEAF Signaller's Cape, which was intended to enable easy location of fallen heroes by aeriel recovery crews.

capes.name: Cloak of Posterity's Gratitude
capes.description: A representation of the thankfulness of those infinite descendents whose liberated existence we strive to ensure.

capes.name: Botslayer
capes.description: A cape that strikes a subroutine emulating fear into the CPUs of all Automatons who conduct visual scans of it.

capes.name: Martyris Rex
capes.description: It is said that only the truly Democratic can lift this cape to their shoulders.

capes.name: Agent of Oblivion
capes.description: 0.05% of profits are donated to Superstone National Park, as part of the Ministry of Unity's "Greener Galaxy" campaign.

capes.name: Eagle's Fury
capes.description: One of the earliest to be mass-produced, this cape has been the final sight of untold numbers of Freedom's foes.

capes.name: Judgment Day
capes.description: The Helldiver Skull is said to strike fear in the hearts of foes attempting to sneak upon those wearing this cape.

capes.name: Fallen Hero's Vengeance
capes.description: Our heroic fallen live on in this cape, guiding its bearer's aim to the heart of those who killed them.

capes.name: Blazing Samaritan
capes.description: Emblazoned with the red, white, and green of the 676th Democracy Regiment, who made their final stand on the slopes of Justice Hill.

capes.name: The Cape of Stars and Suffrage
capes.description: A symbol of Super Earth's Astral Promise: that every star shall one day illuminate throngs of joyous voters.

capes.name: Mantle of True Citizenship
capes.description: The featherlight construction belies the heavy burden this cape entails—to live the Creed of the True Citizen.

capes.name: Freedom's Tapestry
capes.description: Let all who see this cape be struck still with Freedom's beauty, or struck dead with Liberty's bullets.

capes.name: Harbinger of True Equality
capes.description: Wearers of this cape know that even enemies of Freedom deserve to be equal. Equally dead.

capes.name: Standard of Safe Distance
capes.description: By reminding Chemical Agents of proper distancing rules, this extraordinary innovation in cape design ensures that they never cause another unfortunate outbreak of Carcino-Plague

capes.name: Dissident's Nightmare
capes.description: After extensive testing in Patriotic Rehabilitation Centers, this design was proved most terrifying to dissent-afflicted individuals.

capes.name: Pinions of Everlasting Glory
capes.description: All but ensure ascension to the immortal ranks of those enshrined in the Super Earth Digital Archive of Valorous Acts.

capes.name: Order of the Venerated Ballot
capes.description: Adorned with the insignia of the Order of the Venerated Ballot, a Ministry-sanctioned Patriot's Club for citizens who pledge themselves to preserving the sanctity of voting.

capes.name: Mark of the Crimson Fang
capes.description: Marks the most obedient of the obedient, those who will strike headlong at the veins of Tyranny and administer the sweet antidote of Freedom.

capes.name: Executioner's Canopy
capes.description: Crests the shoulders of those who deliver the final—and most indispensable—stroke of Justice.

capes.name: Purifying Eclipse
capes.description: A tribute to the Liberation of Choepessa IV in the First Galactic War, in which so much orbital ordnance was detonated that its sun was occluded by ash for an entire lunar cycle.

capes.name: The Breach
capes.description: As documented in the bestselling graphic novel "The Breach," the final mission of the 361st "Freedom's Flame" saw the storied unit deploy straight into the heart of a Supervolcano, sacrificing themselves to trigger an eruption and wipe out a massive Terminid swarm.

capes.name: Tideturner
capes.description: Some say that a mere glimpse of this cape, fluttering majestically in the breeze, is enough to spur a squad to victory.

capes.name: Light of Eternal Liberty
capes.description: The unimpeachable justice of this cape's design is said to blind the enemies of Freedom with its glorious light.

capes.name: Cresting Honor
capes.description: The yellow is the exact shade of the Ministry of Unity's 'Golden Gate', leading to the Chamber of Unanimous Decision.

capes.name: Liberty's Herald
capes.description: The two stripes serve as a reminder of the two pillars of successful military campaigns: attack, and further attack.

capes.name: Foesmasher
capes.description: Durable, waterproof, and thermally-lined, surplus units of this cape are favored by domestic campers, to make tents.

capes.name: Independence Bringer
capes.description: This cape's cropped length symbolizes the brevity of galatic conflicts, thanks to the efficiency of the Helldivers.

capes.name: Umblemished Allegiance
capes.description: A choir of patriotic schoolchildren sings the Super Earth anthem to each cape as the final step in its productions.

capes.name: Drape of Glory
capes.description: Research suggests that Helldivers wearing this cape are seen as 17% more patriotic.

capes.name: Will of the People
capes.description: Contains a grain of sand from Super Earth—so its bearers carry a small piece of Liberty with them, wherever they go.

offensive.name: Eagle 500kg Bomb
offensive.description: A large bomb obliterating almost any target close to impact. Make sure to clear the area.

offensive.name: Orbital Gatling Barrage
offensive.description: A barrage of high explosive rounds, fired from the Destroyer's high speed rotary autocannons.

offensive.name: Eagle Airstrike
offensive.description: A barrage of bombs creating a non-targeted carpet of explosions.

offensive.name: Orbital Walking Barrage
offensive.description: A linear artillery barrage which moves at intervals, driving the enemy out from cover while allowing an advance.

offensive.name: Eagle Strafing Run
offensive.description: A strafing run of the battlefield to clear small targets, delivered almost instantly.

offensive.name: Orbital EMS Strike
offensive.description: A "compliance weapon" to modify enemy behavior. The projectile temporarily stuns all targets within the strike radius.

offensive.name: Eagle Smoke Strike
offensive.description: A barrage of smoke grenades, creating a thick smoke screen to block enemies' line of sight.

offensive.name: Orbital Gas Strike
offensive.description: A projectile which releases a cloud of corrosive gas, harmful to both organic and robotic lifeforms.

offensive.name: Orbital Railcannon Strike
offensive.description: A high-velocity railcannon round fired at the largest target in close proximity to the beacon. Targeting is automatic.

offensive.name: Eagle Cluster Bomb
offensive.description: A targeted air strike unable to destroy buildings, but efficient at clearing smaller targets.

offensive.name: Orbital Smoke Strike
offensive.description: Creates a large, thick smoke screen to block targets' line of sight.

offensive.name: Orbital Airburst Strike
offensive.description: A projectile which explodes while airborne, creating a deadly rain of shrapnel. Not effective against heavy armor.

offensive.name: Orbital Napalm Barrage
offensive.description: Launches a prolonged barrage of napalm shells over a wide area, setting a swath of land ablaze in mere moments.

offensive.name: Orbital Laser
offensive.description: The Destroyer's laser cannon will sweep over the designated area, vaporizing all targets within the effective radius.

offensive.name: Orbital Precision Strike
offensive.description: A single precision shot from the Destroyer's 'ATLAS' cannon.

offensive.name: Orbital 380mm HE Barrage
offensive.description: A prolonged barrage, wreaking extended destruction over a large area. Communication with teammates is advised.

offensive.name: Eagle Napalm Strike
offensive.description: A barrage of napalm bombs, creating a wall of fire which will stop enemies in their tracks.

offensive.name: Orbital 120mm HE Barrage
offensive.description: A precision artillery salvo over a small area, perfect for taking out concentrated enemy units.

offensive.name: Eagle 110mm Rocket Pods
offensive.description: A barrage of rocket pods, which the Eagle pilot will release on the largest target near the stratagem beacon.

supply.name: MLS-4X Commando
supply.description: An expendable missile launcher equipped with four laser-guided missiles.

supply.name: EXO-49 Emancipator Exosuit
supply.description: A heavily-armored walking exosuit equipped with dual autocannons.

supply.name: M-105 Stalwart
supply.description: A compact, low caliber machine gun. Trades power for ease of use, with faster reloading than heavier machine guns.

supply.name: AC-8 Autocannon
supply.description: A fully-automatic cannon effective against light vehicle armor. Includes support backpack required for reloading.

supply.name: EXO-45 Patriot Exosuit
supply.description: A heavily-armored walking exosuit equipped with a rocket launcher and a heavy machine gun.

supply.name: MG-206 Heavy Machine Gun
supply.description: A very powerful but difficult-to-wield machine gun with intense recoil.

supply.name: SH-32 Shield Generator Pack
supply.description: Encloses the wearer in a spherical shield which blocks high-speed projectiles. Has a limited lifetime once deployed.

supply.name: RL-77 Airburst Rocket Launcher
supply.description: Fires a rocket that detonates within proximity of a target, and deploys a cluster of explosive bomblets.

supply.name: RS-422 Railgun
supply.description: An experimental weapon which prioritizes armor penetration. Must be charged between shots - so choose targets carefully.

supply.name: TX-41 Sterilizer
supply.description: Atomizes caustic chemicals into a fine mist that liquifies sensitive electronics and tissues. Blinds and slows most enemies.

supply.name: LAS-98 Laser Cannon
supply.description: A laser weapon firing a continuous beam. Doesn't require ammunition, but will need a heat sink replaced if it overheats.

supply.name: ARC-3 Arc Thrower
supply.description: Projects an arc of lightning at close range. Charges up to project bolts, and may discharge through multiple targets.

supply.name: AX/AR-23 "Guard Dog"
supply.description: An autonomous drone equipped with a Liberator assault rifle, providing 360° cover. Returns to backpack to rearm.

supply.name: FAF-14 Spear
supply.description: An anti-tank homing missile which must lock onto its target before launch. Effective against large and armored enemies.

supply.name: GL-21 Grenade Launcher
supply.description: A grenade launcher effective against armored infantry. Not intended for use against vehicle armor or fortified buildings.

supply.name: MG-43 Machine Gun
supply.description: A machine gun designed for stationary use. Trades higher power for increased recoil and reduced accuracy.

supply.name: SH-20 Ballistic Shield Backpack
supply.description: A backpack which can be wielded as a one-handed balistic shield, protecting against small arms fire.

supply.name: B-1 Supply Pack
supply.description: Supply boxes containing ammunition, with a backpack that allows the user to distribute boxes to fellow Helldivers.

supply.name: FLAM-40 Flamethrower
supply.description: An incendiary weapon for close range. Will ignite targets, terrain, and any flammable teammates.

supply.name: AX/LAS-5 "Guard Dog" Rover
supply.description: An autonomous drone equipped with a laser rifle, providing 360° cover. Returns to backpack to cool down.

supply.name: GR-8 Recoilless Rifle
supply.description: A recoiless rifle effective against vehicle armor. Includes support backpack required for reloading.

supply.name: LIFT-850 Jump Pack
supply.description: Enables the user to jump higher than 'gravity' and 'safety' would normally allow. Must be charged before use.

supply.name: APW-1 Anti-Materiel Rifle
supply.description: A high-caliber sniper rifle effective over long distances against light vehicle armor. This rifle must be aimed downscope.

supply.name: EAT-17 Expendable Anti-tank
supply.description: A single-use weapon specialized for damaging vehicle armor. Discards after every use.

supply.name: LAS-99 Quasar Cannon
supply.description: Charges up to fire a powerful, explosive energy burst. Has a long cooldown period after firing.

defensive.name: Anti-Tank Mines
defensive.description: Scatters powerful anti-tank mines that deal heavy, armor-penetrating damage. Minefield is less densely packed relative to smaller mines.

defensive.name: FX-12 Shield Generator Relay
defensive.description: A stationary energy shield which provides cover against projectiles. Has a limited lifetime once deployed.

defensive.name: A/M-23 EMS Mortar Sentry
defensive.description: A turret firing static field generators that slow the advance of enemies.

defensive.name: A/MLS-4X Rocket Sentry
defensive.description: A powerful automated turret, effective against armored targets. The turret will primarily aim at larger enemies.

defensive.name: A/G-16 Gatling Sentry
defensive.description: An automated turret with an extremely high rate of fire. Caution: does not check if friendly units are in line of fire.

defensive.name: A/ARC-3 Tesla Tower
defensive.description: A turret which fires electrical charges at targets in close range. To avoid frendly fire, remain prone.

defensive.name: A/M-12 Mortar Sentry
defensive.description: A turret firing powerful shells in a high arc. Effective at long ranges, and able to strike targets behind cover.

defensive.name: MD-6 Anti-personnel Minefield
defensive.description: Deploys a defensive anti-personnel minefield, to halt enemy advance.

defensive.name: A/MG-43 Machine Gun Sentry
defensive.description: An agile automated machine gun turret. Will fire at targets even if Helldivers will be caught in the crossfire.

defensive.name: A/AC-8 Autocannon Sentry
defensive.description: An automated cannon turrent firing anti-tank ammunition over long ranges. Sacrifices agility for range and power.

defensive.name: MD-I4 Incendiary Minefield
defensive.description: Deploys a defensive incendiary minefield, which will set both terrane and targets alight when triggered.

defensive.name: E/MG-101 HMG Emplacement
defensive.description: A manned fortification offering superior firepower against lightly armored targets. Slow to turn, so place it wisely.

loading screen tips: Don't die!
Helldivers traveling the galaxy might come across ancient ruins and other curiosities. Just remember: Only a traitor is curious about alien artifacts!
Practice your daily desensitization exercises to ensure you remain unfazed by enemy atrocities.
If at first you don't succeed, dive, dive again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again. And again.
Don't drink and drive.
Use the Eagle Rearm stratagem during calmer periods to ensure you have those Eagle Strikes available when you need them.
Super Earth recommends spending at least 2.4 seconds per mission enjoying the scenery. A happy Helldiver is a deadly Helldiver.
Friendly Fire isn't.
Don't go it alone – join a squad in order to unleash maximum liberation!
Super Earth has many holidays, but the most important is October 26th – Liberty Day!
The Ministry of Expansion tirelessly works to expand the reach of Freedom and secures vital resources for our society to thrive.
The Super Destroyer can only stay in low orbit for a limited time – watch that mission clock!
The closer you are to the edge of the map, the steeper the angle of incoming orbital bombardments. Physics!
Make sure to pick up your fallen squadmates' sample containers. They're critical for our collective scientific progress!
All Stratagems have their strengths and weaknesses. Choose your Stratagem loadout to best fit the mission and your squad composition.
Don't worry – stims have zero addictive properties!* *Study paid for by Permacura. Permacura: put your life in our hands.
Don't forget to take breaks! ... That is, if you want to be remembered as a coward.
While the Helldiver training program is undeniably infallible, you can always repeat your training from the game menu.
Most enemies have both weak spots and armored spots. The S.E.A.F. training manual recommends aiming for the weak spots.
Most weapons have different fire modes or functions – hold Reload to access them.
Nine out of ten doctors agree that a wound to the chest will make you bleed out if unattended.
Remember: Freedom!
Pay attention to these tips! They've been carefully calibrated to ensure your success.
Don't Panic.
As a last resort, you can use melee attacks to fend off enemies. Remember: death is better than cowardice!
The Automatons are equipped with hyper reactive protocols, making them susceptible to suppressive fire. The more you shoot at them, the less accurate they'll be.
Unhappy with who you are? Change your appearance, voice, and personality in the customization chamber. It's that easy!
If an enemy ever attempts to engage in diplomacy, SHOOT THEM. We mustn't believe their lies.
When you're up against the bots, remember the 3 C's: Cover, Courage, and more Cover.
Remember to fill in your C-01 permit before any act that could result in a child.
Failure to complete mission objectives will NOT result in you being sent to a freedom camp, those are merely dissent rumors.
You are Super Earth's Elite. Remember that.
If you notice a squadmate sympathizing with an enemy, report them to your Democracy Officer. Thoughtcrimes kill!
Diving to the ground can be a life-saver, but it also makes you an easy target for melee units.
It pays to be a straight shooter – angled fire might glance off your target or even ricochet into your squadmates!
The longer you stay in a mission, the heavier the enemy presence becomes.
Day and night sides of a planet are visible during mission selection, allowing you to choose the mission that's right for you!
If the enemies just keep coming, find out where they're coming from and unleash hell. Bug hive? Destroy! Bot factory? Destroy!
Every citizen is equally important to the war effort, but Helldivers are the most important.
Check your Ammo by holding the Reload button.
Grenades detonation time starts when you pull back for a throw – time your throw for an air-burst detonation.
More challenging missions yield greater rewards.
If a squadmate dies during a mission, make sure you pick up their dropped samples. There will be time for mourning later!
Reloading discards the remaining rounds in your magazine.
Your stance has a significant impact on accuracy. The S.E.A.F. manual lists the following stances in order of least to most accurate: Moving < Standing < Crouching < Prone.
Remember to share when calling down supplies. An armed helldiver is a happy helldiver.
Explosive grenades are great against crowds of smaller enemies. Super Earth grenades put the "Demo" in Democracy.
